Ana McClain
EAST CAMPUS
3340 36TH ST SE,
GRAND RAPIDS, MI, 49512-2810
Re: License #: CI410298928
Dear Ana McClain:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 07/01/2025. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Consultant spoke with Chief Administrator about the new electronic system for
record keeping called WeCare. Technical assistance was provided to ensure
for case service plans the date of the report, date of the end of the report
period, and date of the signature of the author of the report is the same date.
Currently in the system it can be viewed the date the report was submitted
which aligns with the report date and end of reporting period date but the
signature date of the author of the report is not until full corrections are made
on the report. It should also be noted upon roll out of the system there was a
glitch that the author of the report could not officially sign the report until the
youth signature was provided. This was corrected immediately as reports were
approved in the system but could not be signed off on until the youth's
signature.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• During the time of the onsite visit, there was no consultation requested or
required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
The review period begins February 27, 2025, until current. The agency was
granted a 1st Provisional License on February 27, 2025. The facility has had no
special investigations during this period of review. Monthly unannounced visits to
the facility have been completed and weekly phone check-ins were completed with
the Chief Administrator and this consultant. The facility has been in compliance
with the implementation of their corrective action plans.

The agency was placed on a 1st Provisional License as a result of special
investigation 2025SIC0000061. The agency was successful in implementing the
corrective action plan that was approved from that investigation and the three
other corrective action plans that were active during the 1st Provisional License.
The staff member that was involved in the physical altercation has since been
terminated and not eligible for rehire. The staff members that were involved with
the concerns of supervision were either terminated or received coaching from their
supervisors. Since going onto a 1st Provisional License, the facility has made
significant progress and improvements into the programs and safety of the youth.
The facility has implemented a classroom expectation form that notes the
requirements of the supervision of the youth within the classroom. This form has
been trained on with all current staff and implemented into the new hire training
orientation. The facility has also implemented a new vehicle usage from/ travel log
that identifies staff and clients present for out of campus activities so the
whereabouts of the youth are always known by the staff. During the reporting
period the facility implemented a robust training program where the leadership
team provided once a month training, (i.e.: supervision, power struggles, self-care
planning, team cultures/support) to address policy and procedure concerns that
have been areas of concerns from the investigations leading to the provisional
license. There was also increased oversight during evening shifts with the campus
wide supervisors doing evening check ins on units with staff and youth. The
supervisors implemented more emotional check-ins with staff, which staff have
reported to be beneficial. All corrective action plans have been implemented and
all action steps have been met in the required timeframes.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility’s
budget and the agency’s financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator report was received on July 9, 2025. Chief Administrator notes
that there were no new special investigations during the first provisional review
period. It is noted the facility continues to work towards getting their certification
with Sanctuary model and largely implemented trauma informed practices
provided by this model with an emphasis on emotional regulation/identification with
safety planning which is used for both the youth and staff. Chief Administrator
wrote, "Additionally the East Campus has had monthly training since the onset of
the provisional that addresses key concerns or areas of need to help develop our

staff to deal with the complexities of the children we serve. These interventions are
helping to address the concerns that lead to the East Campus being on a
provisional license." The facility has implemented a residential administers
meeting at least twice a month to discuss concerns and to make collaborative
decisions regarding practices that impact this license and the organization at large.
The facility plans to continue these improvements even when the facility is off a
provisional license.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff reported well equipped to do their jobs. It was reported staff feel well
supported by their direct supervisors and teammates. Staff reported they have
enjoyed the increased trainings that have occurred as a result of one of the
previous corrective action plans. Staff reported as a team they are still working on
having clearer communication between shift changes but have noted that this has
been improving over the past six months.
Youth did not report any issues or concerns within interviews. They have reported
having a positive relationship with at least one staff member and noted feeling safe
on the unit. Youth reported having a positive relationship with their assigned
therapist. Youth reported one thing they would change about the facility is to have
increased outings.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on July 1, 2025.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
07/28/2025
